numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I looked at the world graph.
2. I noticed that fossil fuels remained the source that generated the most electricity from 2000 to 2020.
3. The electricity generation from gas increased slightly from 2000 to 2020.
4. The electricity generation from coal increased slightly from 2000 to 2020.
5. The electricity generation from nuclear energy remained generally the same from 2000 to 2020.
6. The electricity generation from nuclear energy was about 2 million gigawatt hours.
7. The electricity generation from hydroelectric sources remained generally the same from 2000 to 2020.
8. The electricity generation from hydroelectric sources was about 5 million gigawatt hours.
9. The electricity generation from oil remained generally the same from 2000 to 2020.
10. The electricity generation from oil was about 1 million gigawatt hours.
11. The electricity generation from other sources remained generally the same from 2000 to 2020.
12. The electricity generation from other sources was about 1 million gigawatt hours.
13. The electricity generation from wind energy increased greatly from 2000 to 2020.
14. The electricity generation from solar energy increased greatly from 2000 to 2020.
15. From 2000 to 2010, wind energy was barely used to produce electricity.
16. From 2000 to 2010, solar energy was barely used to produce electricity.
17. From 2000 to 2020, the electricity generation from wind energy and solar energy rose steadily.
18. In 2020, the electricity generation from wind energy and solar energy was about 4 million gigawatt hours.
19. I looked at the country totals graphs.
20. In China, the use of coal increased.
21. In India, the use of coal increased.
22. In the United States, the use of coal decreased.
23. Some countries have climate change goals.
24. I wonder how the data will change when countries come closer to their climate change goals.
25. I wonder whether the electricity generation from clean energy will increase more than the electricity generation from fossil fuels.
26. I wonder what the data was before 2000.
27. The electricity generation in the United States was more steady from 2000 to 2020 than the electricity generation in China and India.
28. I wonder why the electricity generation in the United States was more steady from 2000 to 2020 than the electricity generation in China and India.
29. This relates to my community.
30. The United States generates electricity.
31. The United States generates electricity with clean power or with fossil fuels.
32. If the United States generates electricity with clean power, then the economy will be impacted.
33. If the United States generates electricity with fossil fuels, then the economy will be impacted.
34. The economy affects economic development.
35. The headline is: Shocking News: Coal Remains as the Top Producer of Energy in the World.
